objects you can take advantage of
parallelization by doing a multi-part
upload so you can break your object down
into chunks and you can upload that a
chunk at a time either iteratively or in
parallel so you can take advantage of
the threads you have available the CPUs
you have available or even the machines
you have available to distribute that
out and ensure you're using all of that
network bandwidth and that's going to
increase your aggregate throughput the
other thing that it's going to do though
is it's going to increase the resiliency
of your solution to network failures
because you can imagine if you cut you
whole object and it fails and you have
to start again versus if you've just got
a part of the object that fails and that
has to start again so that's a really
powerful capability another one with
uploads that is worth knowing about is
transfer acceleration now this is where
just by changing the end point in your
upload you can take advantage of the of
the 77 edge locations that AWS has
available and instead of transferring it

whether it's going to be slow or also
unreliable you can actually take
advantage of the AWS Network and what it
will do is it'll send it to the closest
location automatically and then it'll
